quiz.question: Which of the following best describes Appium in the context of mobile app testing?
options: A unit testing tool for mobile apps
A cross-platform end-to-end testing framework
A manual testing framework for desktop applications
A performance testing tool for mobile apps
quiz.hint: Appium is used for writing UI tests that can run on multiple mobile platforms.

quiz.question: What is the primary reason for choosing Detox over other testing frameworks for React Native apps?
options: It supports only iOS apps
It offers a more manual approach to testing
It provides fast and reliable end-to-end testing
It is a paid tool with exclusive features
quiz.hint: Detox is known for its automation and speed in testing React Native apps.

quiz.question: What is a key feature of both Appium and Detox that makes them suitable for cross-platform testing?
options: They require no code changes in the apps
They support only Android applications
They are limited to performance testing
They are designed for backend testing
quiz.hint: These frameworks allow testing without modifying the application code.

quiz.question: Which language is commonly used to write tests in Appium?
options: Python
Swift
Ruby
JavaScript
quiz.hint: Appium supports a language that is widely used in web development and test automation.

quiz.question: Why might a company prefer using Appium for their mobile app testing needs?
options: It only supports iOS testing
It uses proprietary software
It provides a unified API for both Android and iOS
It requires extensive manual testing
quiz.hint: Appium is often chosen for its ability to handle tests on multiple platforms with the same codebase.

preferred_if: User needs automated end-to-end UI tests across platforms
